text.title: Record a Skype Interview on PC or Mac
text.head: Record a Skype Interview on PC or Mac
text.p: This wikiHow teaches you how to record an audio or video interview in Skype for Windows or macOS.
text.head: Steps
Recording a Voice Interview (Windows)

list.item: Install MP3 Skype Recorder for Windows. This free app is recommended by Skype for recording audio calls. You can get it for free from https://voipcallrecording.com.
Open MP3 Skype Recorder. It’s in the All Apps area of the Start menu. The app will launch in “On” mode, meaning it’s waiting for your Skype call to begin.

Select your audio settings. The app will detect your microphone and speakers by default. If you want to select different devices, remove the check mark from the box, then select the appropriate options from the menus.
Select a recording destination. If the default folder under “Recordings destination folder” is alright with you, skip to the next step. If not, enter a different path into the field.
Open Skype. You’ll find it in the All Apps section of the Start menu.
Wait for your interview call. When the call comes in, a notification will appear on the screen.

Click the phone receiver to answer the call. The Skype recorder will record your end of the call as well as the interviewer’s.
When the call is complete, you’ll see a notification that the call has ended. The recording will be saved to the specified folder as an .mp3 file.

text.head: Recording a Video Interview (Windows)

list.item: Install Free Video Call Recorder for Skype. It's a free app by DVD Video Soft.
Open Video Call Recorder. The app installs to the All Apps area of the Start menu. A confirmation message will appear, reminding you to let the other party know you’ll be recording the call.
Click .
Select from the “Recording mode” menu.
Select a recording destination. If the default folder under “Output folder” is alright with you, skip to the next step. If not, click Browse… to select a different folder now.
Open Skype. You’ll find it in the All Apps section of the Start menu.
Wait for your interview call. When the call comes in, a notification will appear on the screen.
Click the video camera to answer the call. Though you’re connected to the call, the recorder is not yet recording.
Return to Video Call Recorder and click the Record button. It’s the red circle button at the top of the window. This records the video call until you press stop.
Click the Stop button when you’re finished. It’s the blue square at the top of the window.
Click . This opens the folder to which the video was saved. To watch the video, double-click it to open it in your default video player.

text.head: Recording an Audio or Video Interview (macOS)

list.item:
Open Quicktime on your Mac. It’s in the Applications folder.
If Quicktime prompts you to pick a file, click Done to dismiss the window.
Click the menu. It’s at the top-left corner of the screen.
Click or .
Click the down-arrow next to the record button. Some options will appear.
Select an audio source. Choose the audio source you want to use in your recording such as the internal microphone or speaker output.

Click red record button. It’s the red circle at the center of the window. This begins your recording.
If you are recording video, you will need to click the screen after clicking the record button to begin recording.
Open Skype on your Mac. It’s in the Applications folder.
Answer the audio or video call.
Return to Quicktime and click Record. It’s the red circle at the center of the window. This begins your recording.

Click Stop when the call is complete. If you were making an audio recording, it’s in the Quicktime window where the play button used to be. If you were doing a Screen recording, it’s in the menu bar at the top of the screen on the right-side.
Click the menu. It’s at the top-left corner of the screen. Now you must export the file to save it.
Click . Several saving options will appear.
Select your audio or video quality options. If you recorded video, select your desired file quality. If you recorded audio, select Audio only.
Name the file and click . The file is now saved to your computer.
